title: AT&T Sketches Out Life After Hollywood
sub_head: After it sheds WarnerMedia, the telecommunications giant plans to enhance services for wireless and internet customers and shrink its copper network
body:
AT&T Inc. offered more concrete plans for its telecommunications operations after it abandons the entertainment business, detailing goals to drop old copper telephone networks and build new fiber-optic lines.
The Dallas company issued new financial targets Friday, while Discovery Inc. shareholders were slated to vote on that company’s plan to merge with AT&T’s soon-to-be spun-off WarnerMedia division. The telecom giant bought the media company, then called Time Warner, in 2018. But AT&T in May announced plans to leave Hollywood.
